result.execSummary:
The defendant Branden J Rombca was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs (Heroin), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Court ordered a fine of $1,500.00 plus applicable costs, surcharges and assessments from bail on deposit with balance to be paid by 1/26/15; any balance remaining unpaid at that time is to be converted to a civil judgment against the defendant. Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample - pay surcharge by 1/26/15; any balance remaining unpaid at that time is to be converted to a civil judgment against defendant.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession; Voting.

Court ordered defendant to pay a fine of $100.00 plus applicable costs, surcharges and assessments from bail on deposit with balance to be paid by 1/26/15; any balance remaining unpaid at that time is to be converted to a civil judgment against defendant.
Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample - pay surcharge by 1/26/15; any balance remaining unpaid at that time is to be converted to a civil judgment against defendant.

records.addlTxt:
Heard in br 34 for br 26
Defendant Branden J Rombca in court with attorney Thomas K. Hackbart.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Statements made as to sentencing.
Count 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 7 DAYS in the House of Correction, with credit for 7 DAYS time served plus a fine of $1,500.00
Count 2:
The Court ordered the defendant to pay a fine of $100.
The court ordered the defendant pay fines plus applicable costs, surcharges and assessments from bail on deposit with balance to be paid by 1/26/15; any balance remaining unpaid at that time is to be converted to a civil judgment against the defendant
The Court ordered the defendant to provide a DNA sample - pay surcharge by 1/26/15; any balance remaining unpaid at that time is to be converted to a civil judgment against the defendant

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession; Voting
Filed,
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement (copy given to defendant);
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
Character letters.  kmw
CASE FORWARDED TO BRANCH 34 FOR BRANCH 26.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Defendant Branden J Rombca in court with attorney Thomas K Hackbart.  Paul M Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin (for ADA Chojnacki).
  Deputy Court Clerk: alp    AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 07-25-2014 at 08:30 am.
Filed by the State:  Witness List, Requested Jury Instructions, Motion in Limine.

Defendant Branden J Rombca in court with attorney Thomas K Hackbart.  Danielle E Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 1, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for July 14, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Branden J Rombca in court with attorney Thomas K. Hackbart.  Danielle E Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case adjourned for a Projected Guilty Plea Hearing in Branch 26 on May 21, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Branden J Rombca in court with attorney Thomas K. Hackbart.  Danielle E. Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 2, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Cash bail that was previously posted to remain. No use or possession of any controlled substances without a valid prescription  Preliminary hearing scheduled for 03-07-2014 at 08:30 am.
